page.title: 09RODNEY STOKE TODAY
page.content: The village has changed in recent years as with many settlements within commuting range of Bristol (approx. 22 miles away). Although these changes are distinctive they are not as pronounced as in neighbouring springline villages such as heddar.New building has been restricted to in-filling and the Parish population (includes Draycott to the west) increased by 10.7% between 1971 and 1981. (17% between 1961 and 1971) The resident population in 1981 was 985 and the Somerset County Council Structure Plan will only permit in-filling in order to preserve the villages rural charm. The increased mobility in society means however ,that more and more newcomers are living here.These people commute to towns like Bristol.Older people resent the changes occuring.
